Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's refugee claim was fairly assessed under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution by LTTE and police in Sri Lanka due to extortion and arrest
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Boardâ€™s decision was not patently unreasonable
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution in Sri Lanka
Legal_Standard: Credibility assessments must be reasonable; procedural fairness must be upheld
Procedural_Issue: Alleged violation of procedural fairness due to reverse questioning
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant deemed not credible due to inconsistencies in testimony
Legal_Provision_Cited: Definition of Convention refugee and person in need of protection
Application_Basis: Claim of persecution by non-state (LTTE) and state (police) actors
Evidence_Assessed: Inconsistencies in narrative regarding arrests and extortion
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review, setting aside of Board's decision
Governing_Rule: A Convention refugee is defined under the Act; procedural fairness required in assessment
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Discrepancies in applicant's account affecting credibility
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm upon return to Sri Lanka due to alleged persecution
Cause_Description: Applicant feared persecution in Sri Lanka due to extortion and arrest by LTTE and police
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility based on internal inconsistencies
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - Definition of refugee and person in need of protection
Evidence_Assessment: Credibility evaluated based on plausibility and consistency
Decision_Rationale: Decision not patently unreasonable; procedural fairness upheld
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration and inconsistent statements
Legal_Standard_Applied: Patent unreasonableness standard on judicial review
